website_summaries.verdict: The All Out Blaze 2 is one of the many Merrell hiking pieces where comfort and support work in unison. However, opposing these rather beneficial characteristics are its sizing and sole design. All in all, the good-looking Merrell All Out Blaze 2 is a light hiker with a decent amount of good points slightly outnumbering its bad points. Interested buyers must be wary of its disadvantages.
pros: Lots of hikers stated that it was lightweight
The arch support given by the All Out Blaze 2 was appreciated by a multitude of owners
It was a comfortable pair of hiking shoes, according to the majority
Based on a moderate percentage of consumer reviews, it had a wide toe box
Less than a handful of verified purchasers liked the pleasing design of the All Out Blaze 2
This Merrell hiker helped a few wearers remain planted on slippery surfaces with its fantastic grip performance
cons: Several users disliked the squeaking sound it produced when walking
It had a stiff sole, as mentioned by a few disappointed hikers
Some Merrell loyalists noted that the All Out Blaze 2’s predecessor was a lot better

customer_reviews.title: Very good so pleased with my choice...
customer_reviews.text: After returning other shoes due to problems, I tried once again with these as I final online attempt as clothing is always tricky I guess. For me: They are very comfortable, look the part like they are ready for action rather than a more casual trainer look. Very light in weight. I’m not wide footed so there is plenty of room forward of the lace area which felt a little odd at first but are fine. Usually an 8.5” I stuck to that on my order and they fit well. Very small slippage on heel... Purchased in Xmas so very good deal and as always, excellent delivery from Amazon. Very fussy, I would recommend :-)
customer_reviews.author: The Count of Monté Cristo

customer_reviews.title: Solid, all weather, warm show with great grips.
customer_reviews.text: Solid, all weather, warm show with great grips. I wore these for the first time during a snowy/icy day here in Scotland and they performed brilliantly. Would recommend. One thing that annoys me is the difference in prices: size 12s are half the price of 12.5 or 13. I hate gambling on shoe sizes, but have found even old favourite shoes to be tighter recently, so often buy a size up in things like this (walking shoes), because they are often worn with thicker socks. Being charged almost double for that is ridiculous. Hence one star dropped for what is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoon Customeer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality as always from Merrell
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to Merrell shoes you know your going to get a quality product, and these are no exception. The fit is good, for me and they are comfortable to walk in. I’ve not had any problems with the insole and they have great grip as you’d expect with Vibram soles. On small point to note, the price on these can vary greatly. I brought them in the sale and not long after they had more than doubled in price.
customer_reviews.author: Carl F

customer_reviews.title: I was happy with them at first but now the rigid plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with them at first but now the rigid plastic inside the back of the shoe has split - both shoes! And the cushioning has worn so now they are unwearable... unless you like a jagged piece of hard plastic sawing into your heel as you walk - then your fine. I used to love Merrells - god knows I've bought enough of them - but they are slipping, big time.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Sims

customer_reviews.title: Merrell moab all out blaze 2
customer_reviews.text: This is my sixth pair of merrell shoes so I am a fan, But this is the first pair of Moab all out blaze II that I purchased and I believe a half size smaller would work better. not as neat looking as the previous model in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Jim King

customer_reviews.title: ... BUYING MERRELLS FOR YEARS AND THEY HAVE ALWAYS BEEN BRILLIANT AND PERFECTLY FITTING
customer_reviews.text: IV'E BEEN BUYING MERRELLS FOR YEARS AND THEY HAVE ALWAYS BEEN BRILLIANT AND PERFECTLY FITTING ,BUT I HAVE TO SAY THESE ARE THE MOST UNCOMFORTABLE SHOES I HAVE EVER WORN, I WISH I HAD OF SENT THEM BACK .BUT I PUT THEM IN A CUPBOARD AND FORGOT ABOUT THEM
customer_reviews.author: Barry O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Misses the comfort of the original version...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe to replace a defective allout blaze shoe. This version 2 is a much narrower one that replaces one of the most comfortable shoes ever built by merrell. Had to return. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Nicholas  K

customer_reviews.title: These walking shoes are very light and easy to adjust for comfort
customer_reviews.text: These walking shoes are very light and easy to adjust for comfort, with really good arch support and grip. They are not the waterproof version, but am happy, as I think my feet would get too hot with the Goretex lining.
customer_reviews.author: Happytohelp37

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable to wear.Merrell always prove one of the most reliable footware suppliers.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Alan Dent

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Spent about 3 solid days on my feet and not a blister or ache in sight. Great shoe and make.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. T. Radford

customer_reviews.title: Not Gore Tex, but a comfy walking shoe, for dry days
customer_reviews.text: Go for half sise larger, but be aware, this version is not gore tex, Even thou they show manufacturer as showing gore tex. Misleading
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not goretex
customer_reviews.text: Have had merrell before , thet are excellent shoes/boots, bought these thinking they were goretex lined, some in the advert are and some not, these were not , be careful what you buy ,returned same day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worth it, close fitting.
customer_reviews.text: very happy with these, quite close fitting but well made. Far more supportive and better walking experience than the bargain basement walking shoes at 20-30 quid.
customer_reviews.author: RegularBuyer178

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great walking shoes I do a lot of dog walking over different terrain and just bought my 2nd pair, happily recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Atky thinks

customer_reviews.title: Great shaped hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: A great hiking shoe as it's foot shaped so very comfortable. They have a good sole with plenty of grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great look, great fit and super light. What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Ridge

customer_reviews.title: ... pair of Merrels years ago that were the most comfortable things I’d ever worn
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as I had a pair of Merrels years ago that were the most comfortable things I’d ever worn. I kind of expected to be disappointed but no these have exceeded my expectations. Good job you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's All Out Blaze 2 Low Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: These All Out Blaze 2 shoes from Merrell are built with premium material, these light hikers offer air cushion viz- responsive cushioning from the inside out.
